intro: Comanthera glabra, commonly known as the smooth comanthera, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweed and related genera. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Its flowers are small, clustered in umbels, and are usually pink or white in color. Comanthera glabra is characterized by its smooth, hairless stems and leaves, which contribute to its common name.
